fehd.ADR_EN: KITCHEN BLOCK AND CANTEEN BLOCK, G/F., PO LIN MONASTERY, LOT NO. 212, NGONG PING, LANTAU ISLAND, NEW TERRITORIES
fehd.ADR_TC: 新界大嶼山昂坪212地段寶蓮寺地下廚部及食堂

reviews.text: A really lovely peaceful and tranquil place just beside the Buddha. A quiet prayer or a walk around to appreciate the structure and building of this monastery. It can get quite busy so choose your times carefully but overall I’d definitely say worth a visit. Not too far from the Buddha and make sure you buy a bunch and light some incense sticks to wish you some blessings.

For me this was the nicest place during the visit in Hong Kong. It was very misty when we arrived in the morning but the weather up there changes quite fast. Would also recommend visiting the restaurant on site. Even the meat lovers in our group enjoyed the vegetarian cuisine

The overall experience is one of a kind. 

At the entrance, is a long pathway that contains the wait line. This shows that it's worth waiting for.

Fly past several mountains via a one trip, long gondola. Plenty of food, shopping and amenities are available at the top

Several statues on the way to the main Buddha attraction with many gift shops and boutiques available to purchase souvenirs.

A quite and peaceful place of religious piety and virtues. Open air prayer space to renew and innovate your religious vows and expectations to the holy one - a big masonry buddha statue with a 250 steps of stony stairway. Should visit for religious renewal journey in life.

The architecture of the Monastery was beautiful, but there wasn't a massive amount to see. It felt somewhat artificial and curated and didn't have much atmosphere. Would maybe have been a better visit if there weren't hords of rude and disrespectful tourists.

The overall experience is one of a kind.
